Authors: Murad D.F., Dwi Wijanarko B., Fernando E., Widjaja Saputra W.J., Darwis T., Lena
Title: Prediction Learning Achievement Indicators in Distance Learning Students
Source title: TALE 2019 - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Engineering, Technology and Education
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Murad, D.F., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dwi Wijanarko, B., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, E., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Widjaja Saputra, W.J., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Darwis, T., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lena, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to predict the main factors that affect learning outcomes of distance learning students. The data used is the data of student learning transactions in 2016 and 2017 as many as 16000. There are 4 assessment indicators of distance learning student learning outcomes, namely Forum discussion (FOD), Personal assignment (PAS), TAS and Quiz (QIZ). The technique is then discussed in terms of prediction accuracy, using machine learning with the Naïve Bayes algorithm with the Rapid Miner application. The results state that student activity in the FOD discussion forum is the biggest indicator that influences student learning outcomes. With performance vector result accuracy of 84.03%. With an active group discussion forum with diverse backgrounds and student characteristics, most of which are workers showing activities, the discussion forum provides knowledge sharing between students and lecturers in the learning process to be both very good and important. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distance learning; Machine learning; Naïve bayes; online learning; recommender system
Index Keywords: Distance education; Engineering education; Forecasting; Machine learning; Assessment indicator; Group discussions; Knowledge-sharing; Learning achievement; Performance vectors; Prediction accuracy; Student characteristics; Student learning outcomes; Students

Authors: Pakuning Desak G.F., Widjaja Saputra W.J., Titan, Mariani V.
Title: Business Process Management (BPM) in Operational BINUS Online Learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Online Learning, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pakuning Desak, G.F., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Online Learning, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Widjaja Saputra, W.J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Online Learning, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Titan, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mariani, V., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: One of the challenges in organizing the 'Pendidikan Jarak Jauh' (PJJ) program is about how to manage the class operational in the online learning environment, in order to support the creation of conductive academic lectures. Therefore, improvement of business processes, technological reliability (technology), and readiness of human resources (people) is very important to be done continuously in order to provide a perfect educational service for all stakeholders concerned. Because of its online environment, every academic operational activities should be run smoothly so the institution could deliver a high-quality services to every stakeholders related. Some of the activity that needed to be improved in academic operational is the exam preparation and planning process. Since it's still manual, the process of it is still reluctant of human-error and very time-consuming. This study aims to implement business process management (BPM) in the exam preparation process in Operational Section of BINUS Online Learning, BPM framework will be conducted and some of tools are used in the research, such as business process model and notation, process selection matrix, and activity-based costing. Based on findings, online exam application came out as a proposed solution. Cost and time saving estimation by 85.85% and 36.04% are the result if the proposed solution will be developed and implemented. © 2018 IEEE.
